title: The question of the extent to which tragedy should be seen as political, or distinctively Athenian, is addressed by D.M

For those who read Greek, Richard Rutherford’s book Greek Tragic Style (Cambridge, 2012) is an excellent guide to the language and poetry of tragedy. Reading matter specifically relating to the neglected tragedians is very thin on the ground.
